summary:
Target-oriented and creative professional with 5+ years of experience in state-of-the-art computational methods, data science, optimization and machine learning. Strong research background with proven publication record in computational fluid dynamics (CFD) and data science applied to offshore wind farm and urban wind applications.

▷ Key skills and experiences:
◉ Strong CAD, mesh generation, numerical and turbulence modeling skills and 5+ years of experience in aerodynamics, single and multiphase flow (VOF), fluid structure interactions and heat transfer
◉ Turbulence modelling using RANS, URANS, LES, SAS and DNS
◉ 4+ years of experience with cloud/parallel/high performance computing (HPC), working with Snellius (the Dutch national supercomputer)
◉ Experienced in performing correlation/optimization studies involving physical test (validation), design targets, and recommended design changes
◉ Practical knowledge in data science with a sound background in numerical optimization, computational science and producing scalable codes
◉Solid experience in formulation & development of efficient codes for computationally intensive problems
◉ Proven research skills in performing quantitative & qualitative analysis uncovering the hidden trends with an extensive publication record

▷Recent projects:
◉ Numerical and experimental analysis of the potential for wind energy harvesting in offshore and urban areas
◉ Sustainable renovation of a 1950's dwelling in Woerden: data analysis and design

▷ Key areas of expertise:
◉ CFD  ◉ Wind energy ◉ Wind farm design ◉ Sustainability ◉ Exploratory data analysis (EDA) ◉ Regression ◉ Principal component analysis (PCA) ◉ Supervised/unsupervised machine learning ◉ Clustering & Classification ◉ Text mining (NLP) ◉…

▷ Key Tools:
◉ Ansys: Fluent, CFX, Design modeler, Workbench, Space claim ◉ Starccm+ ◉ OpenFOAM ◉ Solidworks ◉ EnergyPlus ◉ OpenStudio ◉ Rhino 3D ◉ Sketchup ◉ Autodesk  ◉ Python: Pandas, Tensorflow, Keras, Scikit-Learn, NLTK, Plotly, Matplotlib, Seaborn ◉ Matlab: Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox, Deep learning Toolbox, Neural Network Toolbox, Optimization Toolbox, Classification learner App, Regression learner App ◉ SQL ◉ Power BI ◉…

▷ Personal attributes:
◉ Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset to understand the underlying data trends
◉ Quick and enthusiastic learner with a proactive mindset to learn
◉ Ability to work both independently and within a team
◉ Strong interpersonal and leadership skills with team handling qualities in cross-functional projects

projects:
[{'title': 'Numerical and experimental analysis of the potential for wind energy harvesting off-shore and in urban areas', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Wind energy harvesting in urban areas has recently received growing interest. This is mainly because urban wind energy provides a decentralized local energy resource and can substantially lower energy cost by avoiding the long-distance energy transmission costs/losses. Urban wind energy can be harvested using: (i) stand-alone wind turbines/wind farms installed in urban settings, (ii) wind turbines/wind farms retrofitted on the roof of existing buildings, and (iii) wind turbine(s) integrated into the initial architectural design of the buildings. Due to the complexities of wind conditions in urban areas, the design of an urban wind energy harvesting system needs to be made with special attention to the wind conditions in and
around the buildings.

This PhD research project aims to provide fundamental knowledge on:
(i) The optimal geometry and positioning of building-integrated wind energy harvesting systems; 
(ii) The aerodynamics, power performance and wake interactions of wind turbines for layout optimization of VAWT wind farms in urban areas.

High-fidelity CFD simulations and wind-tunnel experiments are employed. Wind-tunnel experiments area employed for the validation of CFD simulations. The validated CFD simulations are used to characterize and optimize the power performance of building-integrated wind turbines and urban VAWT wind farms.

◉ This ongoing project has so far resulted in 2 journal papers published in the top journals of the field, as well as 3 conference papers presented to frontier conferences (see Publications section of the profile).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sadra', 'last_name': 'Sahebzadeh', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Analytics translator'}]}, {'title': "Renovation of a 1950's dwelling in Woerden, Utrecht, the Netherlands", 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': "Co-supervised a group of 6 last-year bachelor students in analyzing the existing situation and planning the renovation of a 1950's dwelling in Woerden, Utrecht, the Netherlands. The planning was done with a focus on comfort, health and circularity under the overarching target of sustainability.

◉ This project resulted in a final report that allowed the students to achieve top scores in a comprehensive judgement by a committee of supervisors and independent reviewers.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sadra', 'last_name': 'Sahebzadeh', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Analytics translator'}]}, {'title': 'Environmental sustainability in vernacular architecture of south-east Iran', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Vernacular architecture has evolved over time to reflect and sustainably comply with the environmental and cultural contexts. This architecture possesses a variety of original elements and strategies to satisfy necessities imposed by context. Iran’s vernacular architecture has developed different architectures in different regions of the country. Despite their different appearances, these architectures follow the same logic: sustainable adaptation to context. This project studies this logic with a focus on south-east Iran. Elements and strategies of sustainability are studied, specifications of the context are linked to different aspects of architecture and their impact on the architecture is illustrated so they can be used as guidelines for future designs and constructions.

The project goes into more detail in studying the natural ventilation and its elements in vernacular architecture of south-east Iran, including: (i) roofs (Sistani, Filpush and Barrel), (ii) ventilator openings (Kolak, Surak and Dariche) and (iii) walls. Three different compound room types are identified based on orientation and use of mentioned elements by documenting thirty-two sample houses across the region: (1) stretched against the prevailing winds; (2) stretched aligned with the winds; and (3) L shaped. CFD simulations are used to study the wind behavior and evaluate the ventilation performance of these room-types. These simulations lead to guidelines to enhance the ventilation performance of existing buildings and future constructions, including: where to put the windows, which orientation maximizes the natural ventilation performance, where to consider precautions to block the undesirable winds from entering and how far from each other should different room types be built.

◉ This project resulted in 3 journal papers published in the top journals of the field (see Publications section of the profile).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sadra', 'last_name': 'Sahebzadeh', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Analytics translator'}]}]
